Summary Marketing communications strategist with more than 15 years experience developing and leading integrated communications campaigns and delivering consistent results. I enjoy working with a client to identify communications opportunities and applying creative strategies to build brand awareness, improve customer service, generate leads and revenue and increase engagement. As a leader, I encourage cross-team collaboration, proactive communication, initiative, creativity and integrity. 
 
Specialties include: strategic planning, internal and external communications, project management, brand management, supervising and building highly productive teams, reporting and analysis, budget management and fiscal accountability, digital marketing, customer/fan/employee relations. My specialties include: communications strategies; content management; print design with an emphasis in book design; identity systems; editorial, promotional and technical writing; copy editing; conceptual editing; photo retouching; and photo editing

Freelance Communications Kim Kasabian Communications February 2007  –  September 2013  (6 years 8 months) Silicon Valley, CA Content Strategist, Writer, Editor, Designer I work with clients to build and manage their communications needs in a variety of industries, including including education, real estate, entertainment and music. Communications Specialist Stanford University December 2010  –  October 2012  (1 year 11 months) School of Engineering Designer, writer and editor for special projects within the School of Engineering, under direct supervision of the Senior Associate Dean of Finance & Administration. Design projects include logo / branding development for Stanford’s new Science & Engineering Quad, web graphics and content management for multiple administrative units, and new media productions to showcase faculty research projects. Writing projects reflect a broad range, including marketing materials, technical documents, web content, and user manuals. Senior Graphic Designer Alfred Publishing Co., Inc. February 1998  –  February 2007  (9 years 1 month) Creative lead for all editorial and promotional materials for the band, orchestra and percussion division of the world’s largest educational music publisher. Company culture was one of shared governance, working with groups of internal clientele (editors and project managers) to create visually compelling products and promotions for targeted external clientele. Projects included book design with complex style sheeting, book series art direction, multi-component promotions, die-cut product packaging, perfect-bound and saddle-stitched catalogs, display advertisements, trade show graphics, logo development and brochure design. Responsible for art directing photo shoots, freelance illustrators and mentoring junior designers. Writer/Editor Prognosis 1991  –  1993  (2 years) Prague, Czech Republic As a writer, I focused on topics such as health challenges in a post-Iron Curtain society, the environment and the push for the country's inclusion into NATO. 
 
My duties as Eastern Europe Editor included editing, writing and assigning news feature stories from the Czech Republic's eastern neighbors. Summary I'm an experienced writer and editor with a journalism background, including 20-plus years at the Mercury News. My work at the Merc included an award-winning series based on my year spent teaching 7th-grade English in a middle school.The series was especially well-received in the education community. The Merc submitted the series for Pulitzer consideration, but it may have gotten lost in transit, because it did not win.  
 
I now work in communications for Stanford's Financial Management Services, doing communications that are primarily internal to the university. From my job description: "The scope of responsibility ranges from crafting critical communications in support of day-to-day operations to defining and executing integrated communication plans in support of strategic initiatives and projects." 
 
As one might imagine, there are many "strategic initiatives and projects" within Stanford finances. 
 
Prior to coming to Stanford, I oversaw the very broad range of communications at the Santa Clara County Office of Education, which is primarily a resource and support agency for public education in the county. The agency has about 1,700 employees, and serves 30-plus school districts in the county. As one might imagine, there are many "strategic initiatives and projects" within Stanford finances.

Experience Disaster Medical Assistance Team Safety Officer US Government, Department of Health & Human Services, HRSA November 2011  – Present (3 years 10 months) In November 2011, I was officially accepted as a member of the CA-6 Disaster Medical Assistance Team (DMAT) as a Safety Officer.  
 
http://www.ca6dmat.org/ 
 
A DMAT is a team of intermittent federal employees organized under the National Disaster Medical System (NDMS) to provide emergency medical care and to augment local medical capabilities during times of disaster. Disasters may be earthquakes, hurricanes, epidemics, explosions, floods, or other devastating events. DMATs are typically composed of 100 - 150 medical professionals and support staff organized, trained and prepared to activate. In the event of a disaster, a team of about 35-40 will deploy as a unit to provide medical and health care to disaster victims. 
 
A DMAT provides essential medical care at the disaster site, triages and treats victims at casualty collection points, and provides medical care at staging and reception sites. DMATs have responded to hurricanes, floods, earthquakes, heat waves and terrorist attacks. They also pre-stage for large public events such as the Olympics. Our Mission is to advance the profession by promoting the principles of emergency management; to serve our members by providing information, networking and professional development opportunities; and to advance the emergency management profession. Summary Holly Deremo is an Marketing and Communications Specialist at Stanford University in Palo Alto, California. With a focus in strategic implementation and communications development surrounding environmental based programs, as well as multimedia project management. She also manages EH&S'​ program branding and stakeholder relations. In her spare time she conducts research to better understand the use of behavior change to implement long term sustainable resource reduction.  
 
Holly is a graduate of the University of Michigan's School of Natural Resources and Environment where she received her B.A. in Ecological Science, with an emphasis on Sustainability and Communications. While at UM, Holly was vice-president of the Net Impact Ross Business School Undergraduate Chapter, a Planet Blue Student Ambassador (UM's official student sustainability representatives), a student project manager for facilities, and a Communications associate at the Graham Institute for Sustainability research. Following her time at UM, Holly spent 2 years in the consumer products industry at Amway. Summary I've been a content creator for 10 years. I have first-hand experience managing newsletters, establishing editorial calendars, writing articles, copywriting, editing and applying editorial style guide standards. When editing contributing and freelance writers, I make it a priority to keep their voice intact and only make changes for clarity, accuracy, grammar and punctuation.  
 
Whether I'm creating Web content, a blog post or copy for marketing collateral, I can translate information into easy-to-understand language that resonates with a target audience. I'm currently working in a Marketing environment but ultimately I'd like to transition back to internal communications, corporate communications and editorial content. 
 
I take pride in my reputation for delivering accurate and clean copy before deadline. I know how to make meaningful contributions to a team and pay attention to details. Experience Communications Specialist Stanford University November 2014  – Present (10 months) I’m an integral part of Stanford Blood Center’s Marketing and Communications Department as the Communications Specialist. My daily responsibilities include creating content for all communications channels, crafting messages for print, Web, audio and video ads, as well as writing and editing marketing collateral, donor information pieces, event publicity and internal memos.  
 
In addition to working on all marketing projects and donor initiatives, I work closely with the Recruitment and Customer Service teams to make sure staff and donors understand current promotions and campaigns. I am also responsible for creating the messages and slideshows displayed in the donor center canteens. 
 
I created an editorial style guide for the organization that includes everything from the names of the different bloodmobiles and apheresis machines used in our donor centers to the full names of blood industry associations and Stanford entities SBC partners with. I was also the project lead for a thorough audit of SBC’s donor portal, created all content revisions and worked closely with the vendor to correctly apply the changes and successfully launch the new site.  Managing Editor Jameco Electronics December 2013  –  November 2014  (1 year) Belmont, CA My official title was Managing Editor, but it could have been Queen of Content. I created and edited content across all of Jameco’s communications channels. From writing Web content and direct marketing emails to proofing collateral and editing blog posts, I touched everything that came through the Marketing Department. 
 
The majority of my time was spent managing all the moving parts of two monthly newsletters. I slotted stories and managed editorial calendars, conducted interviews and researched topics for articles, managed and edited contributing writers, oversaw the production of newsletter landing pages, ran reports on open and click through rates using SilverPop, and replied to every single email from readers. 
 
The projects I’m most proud of accomplishing in this role were creating the Jameco Blog from scratch on Word Press, establishing standards for newsletter landing pages, and auditing Marketing website pages for consistency and SEO optimization. Internal Communications Specialist UC San Diego Health System November 2010  –  June 2013  (2 years 8 months) San Diego, California I loved being the Internal Communications Specialist for UC San Diego Health System. I primarily managed a variety of internal communications channels, including all aspects of the employee newsletter, from creating it in Constant Contact every week to scheduling distribution to 6,000 employees. 
 
I worked closely with graphic designers to produce and execute organization-wide messaging for employees delivered through screensavers, HD display monitors in hospital lobbies and intranet banners. Those messages usually coordinated with marketing campaigns and were tailored for the internal audience. 
 
I created an Internal Communications Guide and was also on the team that established an Editorial Style Guide for UC San Diego Health Sciences. As part of the Marketing and Communications Department, I often edited and wrote copy for marketing collateral, specifically patient information brochures. I also had the opportunity to support c-suite leadership through PowerPoint presentations and ghost writing memos and speeches. 
 
I worked on several cross-departmental projects in the nearly four years I was at UC San Diego. The most successful was an open enrollment campaign that highlighted the benefits of receiving health care at UC San Diego Health System and encouraged employees to select a health insurance plan that would allow them to choose our doctors as their primary care physicians. Senior Writer UC San Diego Health System/Health Sciences July 2009  –  November 2010  (1 year 5 months) San Diego, California As Senior Writer, I helped write, edit and produce two weekly and one monthly employee newsletters. I worked on several special projects including redesigning and rewriting the new employee orientation PowerPoint for Human Resources, compiling PowerPoint presentations for the CEO, and editing the proposal for a new medical center, which resulted in a $75 million gift.  
 
I also had the opportunity to work with Public Information Officers and wrote press releases on clinical trials and scientific research. I started in this position as a temp and became a career employee a few months later. Technical Writer Nan McKay and Associates September 2008  –  June 2009  (10 months) Greater San Diego Area Working as a Technical Writer for Nan McKay and Associates (NMA) was one of the most rewarding positions I’ve ever had. NMA conducts training across the country to teach others how to correctly execute Public Housing and Section 8 programs through seminars and training materials. 
 
The challenging part of this role was analyzing U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) regulations and translating them from legalese into easy-to-understand language. 
 
My main responsibilities were applying new editorial style guide standards to NMA’s existing library of publications and updating any handbook or training materials effected by a change in HUD regulations. I also wrote biographies and edited case studies and business proposals. 
 
My bilingual skills came in handy when I proofed the training materials for the Puerto Rico Public Housing Authority in Spanish and noticed errors, including that the glossary had been translated but not re-alphabetized. Public Relations Assistant The Alarus Agency, Inc. May 2008  –  September 2008  (5 months) San Diego, California As a Public Relations Assistant at the Alarus Agency, I wrote and edited press releases, pitched to the media and updated media lists. I also reworked PowerPoint presentations and wrote talking points for clients.  
 
My other responsibilities included soliciting donations and creating a trivia contest for a fundraising auction, and staffing a variety of events. Communications Consultant Empire Water February 2008  –  April 2008  (3 months) San Diego, California While briefly working as a Communications Consultant for Empire Water, I coordinated with the graphic designer to develop the look and feel of the corporate website. I also created Web content and management team biographies. Marketing Assistant/Conference Coordinator Basin Water, Inc. December 2007  –  February 2008  (3 months) San Diego, California I had a dual role at Basin Water: Marketing Assistant and Conference Coordinator. My Marketing duties included working on research projects and proposals, writing and editing reports, and other miscellaneous administrative tasks. For nationwide industry conferences, I was tasked with researching dates for attendance, requirements for exhibiting and cost estimates. Communications Director Town of Palm Beach Civic Association September 2006  –  October 2007  (1 year 2 months) Palm Beach, Florida As the Communications Director for the non-profit Palm Beach Civic Association, the majority of my responsibilities were writing and producing town-wide newsletters, creating custom news updates for directors, writing press releases and updating marketing collateral. I was also the in-house photographer, elections point person and media liaison. 
 
I had the privilege of working with nine committees lead by extraordinary Palm Beach residents who ranged from former U.S. ambassadors and politicians, to retired captains of industry and philanthropists. I was tasked with creating monthly agendas and information packets on a variety of topics for each committee, taking meeting minutes, and following up on questions and research requests. Madison County Bureau Reporter The Post-Standard January 2006  –  June 2006  (6 months) Canastota, New York After completing my master’s degree in journalism, I transitioned into a full-time reporter position for The Post-Standard’s Madison County Bureau. My assigned beats included crime and safety, county court, Cazenovia College, the Town of Cazenovia and the Village of Cazenovia.  
 
I covered two high-profile stories of national interest: the trial of the third man to be charged with making a terrorist threat in New York State and the homicide investigation of slain New Hartford Police Officer Joseph Corr. Some of my stories were featured on the front page (A-1) and in all editions of the newspaper (not just the Madison County edition). I also received two photo credits for photos I took of a melted semitruck and the scene of a car accident. Newhouse Fellow/Contributing Writer The Post-Standard January 2005  –  January 2006  (1 year 1 month) Syracuse, New York I was one of two recipients of the Newhouse Graduate Fellowship and Apprenticeship in Newspaper Journalism for Minorities for 2004-2005. While working on my master’s degree, I interned 30 hours a week at The Post-Standard as a Contributing Writer for the Metro and Regional Desks. Most of the stories I covered were community events, guest speakers, business profiles and school meetings. Associate Director SDSU International Business and Economics Internship Program August 2000  –  August 2001  (1 year 1 month) San Diego, California As Associate Director I managed a database that included 300 students and 150 employers for the San Diego State University International Business and Economics Internship Program. I met with students in the program during office hours to answer questions and receive their submissions. I was also responsible for some office administration work, funds management, clerical work and training new staff. Summary You can find me on Twitter @girljournalist. 
 
I’m not your typical journalist. Part techie, part businesswoman, and an entrepreneur at heart, I enjoy learning and teaching as well as experimenting with new ways to produce, package, publish and promote digital content. 
 
When I’m not online or teaching I may be up in the air learning to fly, or in a pool swimming with my daughter. I love margaritas with a kick, hot yoga and cupcakes. 
 
 
Specialties: Content strategy, Content Management Systems, strategic planning, production management, social media planning, social media strategy, social media management, public relations, business development, project management, mobile media, journalism and digital media education.
